resources.string: Orbot is a free proxy app that empowers other apps to use the internet more securely. Orbot uses Tor to encrypt your Internet traffic and then hides it by bouncing through a series of computers around the world. Tor is free software and an open network that helps you defend against a form of network surveillance that threatens personal freedom and privacy, confidential business activities and relationships, and state security known as traffic analysis.

Orbot is an open-source application that contains Tor, IPtProxy (Lyrebird, Meek, Snowflake), hev-socks5-tunnel and LibEvent. It provides a VPN tunnel, a local HTTP Connect proxy (HTTPS only on port 8118) and a SOCKS proxy (9050) into the Tor network.
Automatically start Orbot and connect Tor when your Android device boots
These are advanced settings that can reduce your anonymity
Fingerprints, nicks, countries and addresses for the first hop
Let any app tell Orbot to start Tor and related services
Protocol to use for proxy server: HTTPS, SOCKS4, SOCKS5
Fingerprints, nicks, countries and addresses for the last hop
Fingerprints, nicks, countries and addresses to exclude
Treat Exclude Nodes settings as a requirement for building all circuits. This may break functionality if no circuits are able to be generated with your Exclude Nodes settings.
Run as a client behind a firewall with restrictive policies
Ports reachable behind a restrictive firewall
Enable debug log to output (must use adb or aLogcat to view)
An app wants to open onion server on port %1$s to the Tor network. This is safe if you trust the app.
Put Tor to sleep when there is no internet available
You\'ve switched to a new Tor identity!
Allow Wi-Fi peers, tethered devices and anyone else who can connect to your IP, to access Tor
Port that Tor offers its SOCKS proxy on (default: 9050 or 0 to disable)
Port that Tor offers its HTTP proxy on (default: 8118 or 0 to disable)
Port that Tor offers its Transparent Proxy on (default: 9040 or 0 to disable)
Port that Tor offers its DNS on (default: 9053 or 0 to disable)
EXPERTS ONLY: enter direct torrc config lines
Warning: This could expose your key to other apps
Backup Service (Warning: This Could Expose Your Service Configuration to Other Apps)
Error: An Onion service is already using port %s
Please restart Orbot to enable the changes
Hosted services running, consider disabling battery optimizations
No hosted services running, consider enabling battery optimizations
Use a different circuit for each destination address
Use a different circuit for each destination port
Use a different circuit for each connecting protocol
Keep isolated circuits alive that have at least one stream with SOCKS authentication active
Always enables connection padding to defend against some forms of traffic analysis. Default: auto
Closes relay connections sooner and sends less padding packets to reduce data and battery usage
Enable circuit padding to defend against some forms of traffic analysis
Use lower overhead padding algorithms to reduce data and battery usage
Tells exits that IPv6 addresses are preferred
Tells exits not to connect to IPv4 addresses
Connect through other Tor users using Snowflake (Method 2 - AMP)
Connect through other Tor users using Snowflake (Method 3 - SQS)
Show a message when you help someone circumvent censorship
Hide apps from network monitoring and get access when they are blocked.

Kindness mode allows your device to be a bridge for others. It helps people use Tor in places where it is blocked.

â€¢ It will not drain your battery
â€¢ It will not slow down your internet
â€¢ It can run only over wifi
â€¢ It can be turned off anytime
Connect to the Internet to help people circumvent censorship
Connect to Wi-Fi to help people circumvent censorship
Connect your device to power to help people circumvent censorship
The best way to connect to Tor. Use if Tor is not blocked.
Connects through Tor volunteers. Gets around some Tor blocking.
Likely to keep you connected if Tor is severely blocked. Using this method will launch the Tor Bot Telegram channel. Tap \'Start\' or write \'%1$s\' in the chat to get bridge addresses.
Cloaks your traffic. Gets around some Tor blocking. Requires an email sent from a Gmail or Riseup account.
Cloaks your traffic. Gets around some Tor blocking. May be very slow.
Ask within your trusted networks and organizations to see if anyone is hosting a bridge. If not, a friend can get bridges for you.
Paste the bridge addresses you receive below. Or scan the QR code to add them. Friends can get bridges for you at %1$s.
For users familiar with Tor. Allows you to start Orbot without the VPN setting and shows open SOCKS and HTTP ports
Orbot works best with messaging and social media apps.
Hide apps from network monitoring and get access when they are blocked.
There are many ways to reach Tor. Some may work better than others for you.
You need an internet connection to use Orbot.
Configure how and when your device can act as a Snowflake proxy for other Tor users.
Prevent other apps from taking screenshots of Orbot
Orbot has detected your device is rooted, which can cause security issues.
Warn on startup if root permissions are enabled on this device
Orbot will camouflage itself as the app %1$s. This will hide all notification details about Tor and change how the appearance of Orbot on your home screen.\n\nCamouflaging as %2$s will restart Orbot.
Orbot will resume displaying notification information about your Tor connection and will appear as normal on your home screen.\n\nDisabling Camouflage Mode will restart Orbot.

On Your Samsung Galaxy device Camouflage Mode\'s notifications will only work by opening your Settings -> Notifications -> Advanced Settings and disabling \"Show app icon in notifications\". Click here to open Notification Settings.
Disguise how Orbot\'s icon, label and notification text will appear on your device
Alarms & Reminders Permission Needed for Power User Mode

Please allow Orbot to set alarms and reminders in order to use power user mode. This won\'t actually set any alarms on your device. This permission is needed to have the system keep OrbotService running when Orbot is not being used as a system-wide VPN.
Without turning on notifications Orbot can\'t act as a Tor VPN or use Kindness Mode.\n\nWhen enabled, we only show a single notification when Orbot is running.
Prevent access to Orbot until you authenticate by entering your device password or fingerprint. This can be combined with Camouflage Mode to help hide that Orbot is installed on your device
You need to set a password for your Android device in order to use the Lock Screen feature
Orbot Authentication is not supported on your device
You must download Android security updates for your device in order to use Orbot Authentication
Error asking Tor how to connect
Cloaks your traffic. Gets around some Tor blocking. Good if you\'re on public WiFi, but in a country where Tor isn\'t blocked.
Please unlock your device in order to use %s
This forces Orbot Authentication to only require your device\'s password even if biometric authentication, such as fingerprint or face unlock, are configured on your device.
Run Smart Connect to find the best way
Open Orbot to Connect to Tor
%1$s Kindness Mode helped someone circumvent censorship %2$s
NOTE: Snowflake doesn\'t support proxies. Proxy settings will be ignored with Snowflake bridges.
Choose how Orbot appears on your device
Prevents anyone from taking screenshots of this app
Require your device Password, PIN, or biometrics to unlock Orbot
If you are using the Lock Screen setting, this stops any biometrics that you may have configured to unlock your phone - such as your fingerprint or Face ID - from unlocking Orbot
Setting up connection through Tor network
Finding alternate route to Tor network
